website_summaries.verdict: A great storage option with average read and record speeds. If you plan to do 4K recording, though, look elsewhere.
pros: Good for full HD video content and HD photography, as well as smartphones, tablets and drones
Read speed of up to 85MB per second
cons: Not the best choice for 4K recording
Genuine cards work well, but some customers receive counterfeit items

customer_reviews.title: More counterfeit flash memory from Amazon
customer_reviews.text: Another counterfeit item from Amazon? I have a 50% failure rate on getting items that are obvious fakes. This card was sealed in the cardboard packaging, but cutting it open shows the plastic sleeve holding the card is sealed with a piece of scotch tape. The card itself barely gets 1/2 the rated rated speed on USB 3.0 ports with the right adapter. Other flash memory works correctly at rated speeds. Be careful and check your memory, commingled inventory means that Amazon can have fakes.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony M. King

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working well short of a year
customer_reviews.text: After about 6 months it completely stopped working. Thought reformatting it would work but it did not. Thought it was my cell phone so I put it in another cell phone and the computer and does not work. Allegedly under 1 year warranty; however, apparently I need the original packaging. Doubt if I can find it and the number to call for warranty support is really tech support and all I could do was leave a message. Not optimistic I wilil get a warranty replacement but I will update if I do.
customer_reviews.author: Nomore privacy

customer_reviews.title: Counterfeit or Wildly Defective; lucky it didn't damage my computer
customer_reviews.text: Counterfeit or Wildly Defective. Opened the clamshell packaging, put the micro-SD card into the adapter, put the adapter into my Macbook Pro. It didn't show up in the Finder or Disk Utility, but I soon noticed a horrible smell as the plastic adapter began smoking. It doesn't seem to have damaged my MBP (other SD cards still work) but this has to be counterfeit or wildly defective.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Gentry

customer_reviews.title: Failed after 12 months by randomly becoming permantly Write protected
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for about 12 months until it randomly decided to become write protected. No number of different computers, memory card readers, cameras, disk formatters, or disk partitioning would work to remove the write protection. So, I am now stuck with 128GB micro sd card that is half filled with personal files and can not be used to write or change anything new on it. Guess I'll need to take a hammer to it to clear the data off as its useless now... PNY customer service, will you make this right?
customer_reviews.author: Jon and Nicki

customer_reviews.title: worked for a year, then ruined my weekend...
customer_reviews.text: I had been using this in my Nikon camera for about a year for light-duty photography, I maybe used the camera 20 times in that year. Over the weekend, I was shooting video out near a waterfall when, for no reason at all, the card corrupted and I lost everything I had been shooting that day. Luckily I was able to get 75% back with a card recovery program, but I am never taking the risk on this brand again. I have never had this happen with Samsung or SanDisk. Once I'm sure I have all the files recovered off of it, this is going in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn King

customer_reviews.title: Failed less than 5 months later
customer_reviews.text: One of the two MicroSD cards failed after less than 5 months. Stuck in read only mode even after trying multiple computers, using diskpart to force it out of read only mode (says it was successful yet still says read only) and using the adapter. Any time I insert it into my PC, Windows immediately finds errors but can't fix it due to stuck in read only. This occurs whether I use the MicroSD to SD adapter or not. Even though PNY reassured me the 2 I received were not counterfeit (even though the plastic housing they came in was held together by tape....), I feel like I was given bad information.
customer_reviews.author: Jon B.

customer_reviews.title: fake or poor quality reader
customer_reviews.text: I'm getting ~13MB/s sustained large file write speed. Which means that either I have a fake card or the reader that comes with the card is complete garbage. Even if it is the reader that doesn't make a whole lot of sense to me since USB 2.0 supports around 30MB/s read/write speeds. Looks like a lot of people got fake ones... doesn't look good for AMAZON or PNY! These seems to happen a lot on AMAZON... What's the point of spending $30 on Amazon for a 128GB fake card when I could get a 256GB fake card on eBay for $30.
customer_reviews.author: William D. Murphy

customer_reviews.title: I put it in and it smelled like burned plastic
customer_reviews.text: This card is DANGEROUS! It ruined a retro case. I put it in and it smelled like burned plastic, I pulled it out and it burned my fingertip, it almost caught on fire, and left burn marks on the case. It didn't ruin the raspberry pi amazingly enough, it just decided to meltdown. I got it RMA'd, but to be honest, I don't want another one to ruin whatever else I put it in. I have tons of san disk and samsung, none of them have done this... not a great first experience with pny...
customer_reviews.author: Steve Snyder-Hill

customer_reviews.title: Great and spacious SD card
customer_reviews.text: EDIT: SD card stopped working today after using it in a Surface 3. States that it is write protected, my Kindle claims it's unstable and corrupted. Will no longer be using. Original Review: Great and spacious SD card! I'm currently using this SD card in a Samsung Chromebook Plus without any issue. I've also used it in Android tablets without a problem. Works as intended!
customer_reviews.author: Thrifty Student

customer_reviews.title: Corrupted and lost it all....twice!
customer_reviews.text: I don't know, maybe I'm just the unlucky one but I bought this to put in my new Samsung S7 edge. It took about 100 pics and said it was corrupted. I lost what pics I had taken and reformatted the card. This time it took 125 pics and same thing happened. Really ticked, wasted money and lost good pics of my family's summer that I couldn't even back up before it crapped out :( Never used PNY before and never will again!
customer_reviews.author: JMG

customer_reviews.title: Nothing to rave about.
customer_reviews.text: Certainly works as designed, pretty colors, decent price and came with its own adapter. Two things that I wasn't thrilled about. Packaging was for retail, which means I needed sharp shears and a steady hand to free the contents and the card itself was identified as a Transcend product - not PNY - on my Android phone. Waddup widdat, bro?
customer_reviews.author: trdavidson

customer_reviews.title: Not a very reliable SD Card.  I had to return due to storage migration issues
customer_reviews.text: I bought this card hoping to store a ton of music on it for my underground metro rides when streaming is not an option. However, when I tried transferring a folder of about 55GB of music, the card became corrupted during the process. I tried several times to format the card and try again, but each time, the card would freeze up and become corrupted. I ended up sending it back and buying another brand which works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: oydannyboy611

customer_reviews.title: Died in less than a year, data integrity issues throughout
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for use with the Nintendo Switch. More often than was acceptable after downloading software it would immediately or soon after using state that the data was corrupted and needed to be redownload. After a few attempts it eventually would download successful. It seemed like finally it stopped doing this for whatever reason then a few weeks ago it just straight up died. Based on internet searches this is not uncommon. Less than a year old. Product is poor and fails. Don't waste your money and buy another brand of storage.
customer_reviews.author: Estevan A.

customer_reviews.title: I bought two, both stopped working.
customer_reviews.text: I have had 3 of these go bad now. The last one PNY called me and troubleshot it and then send me a new one (great service). It lasted a month and this one did the same thing. Locks and doesn't allow you to write to it anymore. Just shows up as protected. I have several Samsung and Sandisk cards I use for the same purposes and never had an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Card lost cherish memories.
customer_reviews.text: Worked with no problem on my BLU R1 HD phone I bought on Amazon. Till 4 or 5 months I started having problems with the phone apps started to crash. One time it had issue SD card I had take out and put it back. But last I removed bunch pictures after that phone froze up. I rebooted the phone since then card can be read in phone or on my PC. I bought September 5 2016 so I got about 10 months trouble free. I more sad or pissed about. Some of pictures I lost my mother happy and laughing. Since she Alzheimer's I cherish those moments.
customer_reviews.author: Peter U.

customer_reviews.title: PNY Elite 128GB, up to 85MB/Sec, Microsdxc Card.
customer_reviews.text: I use this in my galaxy tab S2. has worked flawlessly. I pop it out.. write my movies onto it.. pop it back in..128GB can hold a LOT of movies. I have never had a problem with PNY products. i have never compaired them for speed, but they must meet or exceed the speed for the class shown on the cards or they wouldnt be classed that speed. I have found these to be 100% reliable. and the best deal price wise i have seen (for any major brand) I wont use a knockoff or noname. this includes the thumb drives from 32 64 128 and 256. i have never had a failure or disapointment with these pny products.
customer_reviews.author: stumpedI

customer_reviews.title: Specs good, hopefully performance will match....
customer_reviews.text: Listed specs indicated that this has a "up to 85MB/Sec " which seems pretty good. Other pricier brand was "up to 90". Just installed and my Moto Droid Z reported "this SD card seems slow, app performance may be degraded". Will monitor performance and update this in a week or so..... Usual sealed SD card packaging which had to be basically destroyed to open, so not sure about return options......
customer_reviews.author: jt

customer_reviews.title: This went in my phone when it arrived and has ...
customer_reviews.text: This went in my phone when it arrived and has not been removed. Now programs stopped working, and when i tested the card, it is readable, but not writable. To correct it, I've tried formatting it, but it stops at 20%. I took it out and attempted to format on the computer. It reports being Write Protected, but it is not. It's dead!
customer_reviews.author: Mark Trevithick

customer_reviews.title: Great Deal. Lotta space for the cash. Works quickly with phone.
customer_reviews.text: I had never really used or been familiar with PNY products but this is good stuff. I was slightly skeptical because it was priced noticeably lower than competitors (at least when I bought it), but I'm confident in this product now. I've slammed 2 big vacations worth of pictures (I take A LOT) and I really have even dented the space available in this card. Appears to work very quickly with my Samasung Galaxy S7. I've seen phones take a long time to load pics or data on a micro SD but this one works quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Back up your data; failed after about a year.
customer_reviews.text: This card worked great for about a year, then it got close to being full. It's showing 105 Gb used of 119 available, and I can no longer save anything to it, even if I try deleting to free up space. Also, apps that have been using it cannot transfer data from the card to my phone's internal memory. In essence, I can still access what's on the card, but I can't save anything new to it and I can't transfer anything off of it. I'm really glad I have the data backed up elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: SLO

customer_reviews.title: Late to the game. Fake SD card.
customer_reviews.text: I'm late to the game. I bought my "128GB" in 2016 from Amazon. It is a fake and only registers 10 GB. I just thought my phone was having issues all these years but finally started to look at the card and came across that these can be counterfeited. Super disappointing. You might want to shop elsewhere for a microSD card or verify it immediately after purchase with an app of some sort. I did order a second one that was successfully real, but a 50/50 chance isn't worth it to order again.
customer_reviews.author: Jimi Bertman

customer_reviews.title: Nice, until it fails.
customer_reviews.text: This did the trick for me, extending my Moto's storage capacity until apps suddenly stopped working. My PNY MicroSD had become read-only, although there is no way to trigger this yourself, or un-trigger it once it happens. I was able to use an adapter and third-party software to back up the gigs of data trapped inside and will find a replacement from a more reliable company.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: If you're looking for an 18GB SD card, look no further.
customer_reviews.text: It took me a while to end up using its full capacity (as I bought this for my Galaxy Note 4), but when I did, I was sorely disappointed. This card does not store anything close to 128GB. It is currently at about 18GB and my devices are telling giving me "SD card error" notifications. After I delete some material the messages go away, but they always return when I reach the much-lower-than-advertised max capacity. The funny thing is that all my devices tell me there are over 100GB left of free space. Anyways, this purchase was disappointing and I hope more people don't get ripped off.
customer_reviews.author: Welch

customer_reviews.title: Works Great, Not as fast as it says.
customer_reviews.text: In order to work with Android phone, you must format with FAT32. Downloaded a couple of free programs for that & works beautifully with computer, tablet & phone. No way to get 85MB/s, but they all lie about that. Can get 17-20MB/s (with adapter) which is fast enough for movie watching on tablet & phone, and not too bad for loading card. I found a web page which explains the markings on the micro SDcard, which lets me know the true speeds possible. [...]
customer_reviews.author: Joe G.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Little Cross-Platform OTG Device
customer_reviews.text: Very compact and versatile OTG reader. It was immediately recognized by both my phone and tablet and can be used to read my external files, photos & videos and more. I am very happy with its read/write speeds and secure connection(s). It appears well made to last many years. Now I am more able to use this for files and applications between devices while maintaining consistent up-to-date data. This was a good purchase getting an OTG reader along with a 128GB micro SD card for less than buying only the SD card.
customer_reviews.author: Richard L.

customer_reviews.title: This is my Second PNY thought it was a phone issue but cell repair shop said they see this a lot and to stick to brands like sandisk. popped old san disk in worked just
customer_reviews.text: Do not get! After a few months in my phone the card just stop being read. Moved over to computer unable to read also. This is my Second PNY thought it was a phone issue but cell repair shop said they see this a lot and to stick to brands like sandisk. popped old san disk in worked just fine
customer_reviews.author: Khrystof

customer_reviews.title: I purchased this junk card a year and a half ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this junk card a year and a half ago, and today this card silently died with all my pictures, music, documents and other stuff :( It was my first try PNY brand purchase but I can say now: I'm not too rich to buy that cheap stuff :( So, DO NOT BUY these cheap and unreliable cards from PNY, it will cost you finally too much.
customer_reviews.author: SeNS

customer_reviews.title: Advertised speeds are false
customer_reviews.text: Don't let there claims of how quick this product is fool you and go with a sandisk. True read speeds are 39 mb/s and write speed of 19. This card is in fact making my phone lag with every button I press (samsung galaxy). I am now stuck with a worthless $30 card and am going to have to spend another $30 on a card that is fast enough to not slow my phone down.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan W.

customer_reviews.title: Great card for phones, and tablets.
customer_reviews.text: Great cards for the money.. Not super fast cards, but great for phones, and tablets. I have about six of these cards now, and so far not a single issue.. Not 100% sure how well they would work with the gopro cameras. But again I didnt buy them for that. If you want a good card for the gopros. Check out PNY's Pro Elite cards.. I do have a few of them and they do work great with the gopro cameras, and handle 4k with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: FujiXsh00ter

customer_reviews.title: Was a good deal when I got this
customer_reviews.text: Was a good deal when I got this. Works well, speeds aren't as advertised obviously. Rarely the speeds are which I've grown accustomed to. It is still a fast card though none the less. I have not had any issues with the card not being recognized by any devices and haven't had any issues with any corrupted data unlike my old Sandisk card. I would recommend this product highly.
customer_reviews.author: Brotherdave

customer_reviews.title: This product works nicely even if Samsung tried so hard not to get it to work.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for a Samsung G8. It doesn't fit in the "proprietary" card device and samsung warns against using a "non samsung card". BUT, I DID get it to work after some "fiddling". This product works nicely even if Samsung tried so hard not to get it to work. I would've given a five star review, but the maker didn't specify that Samsung devices would be difficult to just "insert and use". Although, I suspect the maker might not have known this.
customer_reviews.author: musicluva

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 21 days, then dead.
customer_reviews.text: This PNY 64GB card lasted 21 days until it became irrecoverably corrupted. Card will not accept attempts to reformat, if it allows itself to be detected at all. I'm extremely frustrated and dissatisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Kidflyr

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: **UPDATE*** It's been a little over 1 year since I purchased the card. It was purchased on July 12, 2016. The card is now failing. It was having trouble reading so I formatted it. Worked fine for 3 days and then died again. I've always known PNY to be great products, hence the purchase, but failing almost a year in is disappointing. Love PNY products. I got this card to use in my Wii U and it's been working great.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Fast and Cheap!
customer_reviews.text: I've only had the card a few days but so far it's great. I tested it with CrystalDiskMark 5 and got 85 read and 35 write. The slowest read I saw during the tests (I did a few) was 83.7 and the slowest write was 34.6 so pretty consistent. I did the testing using the internal card reader on my venue 11 7140. I repeated the test on my Acer One 10, a cheap atom windows tablet and the results were quite lower so the speed definitely depends on your card reader too.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon N. Cummings

customer_reviews.title: Junk.  EDIT:  maybe not
customer_reviews.text: I had a hard time setting it up and thought it was an error between the user and the chair. Today it went corrupt... which it seems to have been doing for some time and windows thinks it's write protected. Will NOT buy this brand again. I did some research and discovered that my brand of phone has a known habit of killing sd cards. changing this to a 4 star review due to lack of knowledge about what caused the failure.
customer_reviews.author: Athanasius

customer_reviews.title: amazon has a bad batch of these DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: returned and exchanged and returned again... both were supposed to be 64g, both wanted to be formatted from the beginning as 25.9g max. amazon has a bad batch of these DO NOT BUY. amazon needs to remove these from the market place. beyond a disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: N. Pole

customer_reviews.title: Not Reliable
customer_reviews.text: Very unreliable. This thing gave me issues with my Samsung S7 Edge 2 months after purchasing it outside of it's return window...i definitely do not recommend this if you are looking for something that lasts.
customer_reviews.author: Dominik

customer_reviews.title: Great micro sd card
customer_reviews.text: Great micro sd card. Have purchased several PNY cards over the years and never had trouble with any of them. Great card and a great price too. Will fit most any need you have for a micro card. Works great in cameras, smart phones, or any thing that needs a high speed card. Highly recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Claims 85MB/sec, definitely not!
customer_reviews.text: I've had it for 1 year and 2 months, and my Galaxy S7 has never liked it, it's always had issues. If PNY/Amazon responds to this and offers a replacement, I will change this review. Otherwise I believe I received a lemon, or the 128GB version is awful, don't get it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not fast enough to be used for Android Adoptive Storage
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this microSD card specifically for use with a Shield TV to take advantage's of Android's new "adoptive storage" feature. Sadly, after the Shield TV tested this card and its performance, it reported it was TOO SLOW to work as adoptive storage, even though this appears to be a UHS-1 card. I'n not sure if PNY is deceptively marketing this card, or if it just can't attain the required speeds, but this was a disappointment. Furthermore, I tossed the packaging so I couldn't return it... Waste.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Use this as your external storage device and then the reader allow plug in to stardard USB "and" Micro USB port
customer_reviews.text: You simply slip the micro SD directly into your device (in my case it's my HP x2 210 tablet / laptop) and use as your external storage. You can then remove the micro SD and place into the Reader. You can now plug the Reader in to a 1) Standard Type A (computer USB plug in) you have that on one end then 2) if you need to plug in to a Micro USB port (smart phone) you have that on the other end. Yes you have two male plug in's; Standard type A USB and Micro USB.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne N.

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended
customer_reviews.text: I have extensive experience using SD and Micro SD cards over the years. This purchase was the first time that I purchased a card that was dead upon arrival. It cannot be recognized via various card readers on various machines. With something as important as data and/or photo storage, I recommend you trust another company.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew K.

customer_reviews.title: Simply junk!
customer_reviews.text: Not compatible with Galaxy S7. It connects, but then randomly dismounts after a short period of time. I tried using it on a windows tablet and another windows laptop, and while it is visible and accessible on both, and does not disconnect randomly, whenever I try to write to it, the entire system freezes up. This thing is a piece of junk. Too bad that while I was trying to get it to work, my 30-day return window has passed.
customer_reviews.author: itsmarik

customer_reviews.title: Not durable enough for dashcam recording
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use in a BlackVue DR650S-2CH dashcam. It worked fine for a few weeks but then the camera started generating an error saying check SD card. I switched back to the card that came with the camera and its working fine. I may switch to using this for less intensive uses like in a Raspberry Pi.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel

customer_reviews.title: Once you have it, you wonder why you didn't have it sooner.
customer_reviews.text: Just awesome. The 128 gb card works in my phone, and the "reader" with an older 32 gb card pulls duty as my thumbdrive- I never really realized just how useful it could be to be able to plug a thumbdrive into both a PC and a smart phone... Seriously, this is one handy little tool.
customer_reviews.author: Andy T. Knote

customer_reviews.title: Affordable memory expansion
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this card to expand the memory on my Note 7 and it worked straight out of the package. Pro: I have not tested the speed; but I have not had any problems transferring files to the SD Card. It is a good quality card that provides a large amount of memory for a really affordable price. Con: The one drawback is that after formatting there is only 119 gb available on the card. Overall the card does what it was meant to do efficiently. I would recommend it to anyone looking to expand their memory capacity on a budget.
customer_reviews.author: YR

customer_reviews.title: PNY... only brand sdcard I buy...
customer_reviews.text: PNY is the only brand sdcard I buy. SanDisk became plagued with knockoff's couple years back. Whether or not the market saturation of these has died off or not, I will never switch back!
customer_reviews.author: coolbeans2016

customer_reviews.title: I have not had the card 1 month and it ...
customer_reviews.text: I have not had the card 1 month and it melted down, litteraly. The carrier adapter melted and deformed teh actual card cracked and discolored due to the heat.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick J Bell II

customer_reviews.title: Works as described, best bang for your buck!
customer_reviews.text: I picked up an LG G5 32GB. Since this phone has expandable storage, I was able to expand the on-board storage from 32GB to 160GB using this 128GB MicroSD card. I purely using the MicroSD card to store all photos and music (including Spotify downloads) so that the main phone storage is free for application updates, and system updates. I've now use this card for over a few weeks and have no encountered any issues.
customer_reviews.author: Thang Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed  - not what i expected
customer_reviews.text: Card has never worked. Bought for new Samsung Galaxy S7 Active right before going on vacation. Transferred music and took pics - hought I was saving to card but was saving to phone. Phone just now got full and so I became aware of the problem. Card shows as corrupted. Also, didn't receive card as advertised . Doesn't show "Elite" - see attached picture of actual card received.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Good quality Micro SD Card.
customer_reviews.text: I have had a couple poor experiences with micro sd cards and have higher hopes for this one. So far the read and write speeds seem to be pretty good. The price was great on this one and the capacity is large. With people depending so much on phones and tablets these large capacity cards are a godsend. One the 200gb cards come down a bit I may pick one up but for now this is working great in my Samsung Galaxy S7 Edge and holds quite a lot of photos.
customer_reviews.author: Sean C.

customer_reviews.title: Turned out to be fake. 16GB capacity.
customer_reviews.text: When I hit 16GB, it failed. I installed a program on my laptop that tests SD cards, it fails testing. Error writing file 'D:\4.h2w', offset 0x5e00000. It is still possible to verify the test data written up to this point. (The volume for a file has been externally altered so that the opened file is no longer valid. Code 1006) Warning: Only 104150 of 119968 MByte tested. Writing speed: 726 KByte/s H2testw v1.4
customer_reviews.author: Steven J. Greenfield

customer_reviews.title: Tiny and Fast with a high capacity
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on time and works great in one of my cameras (A Samsung WB-380F) I wanted a card larger than the 64GB PNY card that I had previously purchased, as I go on extended trips abroad and take a great deal of photos. The card is faster than my camera's abiltiy to write to it, so you may get much faster writing results with a better point and shoot camera. The SD adapter works with other PNY cards and I couldn't be happier with this card's performance and additional storage capacity.
customer_reviews.author: Stevie B

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the value. Go with a more reliable brand like Sandisk, Samsung or Lexar
customer_reviews.text: Not a very good card. It only works with a limited number of devices. It worked on my Switch for a couple of months and then stopped working out of the blue. Thought it was my system that had an issue, but ended up being the card.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Argueta

customer_reviews.title: Crapped out in a year
customer_reviews.text: Shortly after a year of my 128 GB PNY micro SD card, it's failed to a "read only" state, however hardly is readable by many of my devices. Card can no longer be formatted by any means
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: Card doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: The card doesn't work! Tried in my device that uses micro-SD cards, and it gave me an error "Invalid Card" and I also couldn't use it with the SD adapter on my computer. Completely useless and a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: not up to speed (card reader) card is ok
customer_reviews.text: not even close to the 85 meg advertised speed, avg is about 16-18. see test url this in usb 3 port, but the reader that comes is only usb 2.0 but the advertised speed of 85 is way way off actually it is the card reader that is the issue. when testing with a Lexar usb 3.0 reader that came with one of their flash cards it got about 80 meg read speeds.. so at least under windows 7 the card reader is not up to snuff
customer_reviews.author: lgkahn

customer_reviews.title: Great until it wasn't...
customer_reviews.text: Bought the 128 GB version for my Nintendo Switch and it worked perfectly fine, until it just died out of the blue. It is past any one year warranty it might have had and am disappointed that I have to purchase another card so soon.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Snell

customer_reviews.title: Waterproof
customer_reviews.text: Storage capacity? That would ONLY depend on the size of the SD card (other than the 32GB that came along). But it still working after finding in a pair of jeans after wash and dry leaves me impressed.
customer_reviews.author: JSA3D

customer_reviews.title: Great product for a great price.
customer_reviews.text: I love the sleek style and the minimal space it takes. I have A ScanDisk OTG 64 GB, its cool but sometimes i would like more space. With this, i can use any Micro SD card and plug it in my phone. One reason i would use this is for transferring files from my camera to phone. Usually, i would need to connect a micro usb reader then transfer files to computer to phone. Now i can just transfer them directly.
customer_reviews.author: KROD

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected. Budget friendly.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great card for storing just about anything. I use it in my LG Aristo (which totally supports it despite claiming to only support up to 32GB [haven't tested speed but it is fast enough for media content in 1080p as well as storing higher than default bitrate video from my 13MP camera]) and I'm enjoying it. I will likely buy another when I can afford it.
customer_reviews.author: Shane

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive yet worthwhile investment.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent solution for helping back up documents and picures on my wife's Windows Netbook. These newer Google book and alike have no room for uprgades with even Windows and proprietor upgrade/program updating.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Wiggins

customer_reviews.title: PNY is great but does not make anything better than a V30
customer_reviews.text: for what i need works $$$ but if i need something better than a V30 PNY wont deliver It's a SD card works good no problems free from defects best price $$$ quality
customer_reviews.author: Jason D. Travis

customer_reviews.title: Speeds are lackluster, but it's working so far
customer_reviews.text: Works as intended, but the speeds are no where near as advertised. I'm getting ~45MB/Sec if i'm lucky. Time will tell if this is a faulty/fake unit. I'll update this review a few months from now based on how reliable this card is.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Trujillo

customer_reviews.title: Terrific Storage Device
customer_reviews.text: Terrific card - high capacity for a great price. I bought a laptop with a micro-SD slot, and this card fits flush with the laptop's side when inserted and was instantly recognized and easy to format. Was up and running in just a minute. Would definitely recommend and buy again as a very cost-effective way to add lots of storage space to a micro-SD ready device.
customer_reviews.author: Stevie

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy, Amazon! !!! Thank You! !!!
customer_reviews.text: It, so far, has been EXACTLY what I had hoped for. The Post Office here almost lost it at delivery though, but that does not appear to be yours or the suppliers' fault, or UPS either. The Post Office did find it, and your tracking system was totally invaluable to the process. You had me completely covered with your documentation which came up on my Android perfectly!!! So, we're good, Amazon - VERY GOOD! THANK YOU. Robyn Forrer
customer_reviews.author: Reverey Ravencurse

customer_reviews.title: Junk card
customer_reviews.text: Card died in about 8 months. Bought it for switch worked fine for awhile has never been taken out of switch. Last night started getting errors that all card is unreadable and can’t be formatted with all my games saved on there. Can’t recomend this card as reliability is poor if it doesn’t even lag a year
customer_reviews.author: michael seelhorst jr

customer_reviews.title: Much better than the external hard drive I was using before
customer_reviews.text: I'm not one of those who would bother testing the card speeds with special testing software, but in my personal experience using this card, it's very fast! Much better than the external hard drive I was using before. I'm using this with a SD Card Slot adapter to permanently add storage to my computer, and it's great for holding media and playing off of it. For the price, you can't beat this!
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Grelewicz

customer_reviews.title: Zero for two
customer_reviews.text: Bought one: it failed before I even finished copying my data. Received a replacement: it worked long enough for me to finish copying my data, then failed. Also, both of them had very poor transfer speed. Additionally, I am an IT Professional. I tried multiple readers and did all the troubleshooting I could. These cards are just terrible.
customer_reviews.author: Deidre

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: A little over a year and already dead. Update 9/28/17. PNY Replaced the defective card. The replacement card formated first try in my Moto G5 Plus. Had to fight with the old one. The phone did not complain about speed nor have any trouble formating it.
customer_reviews.author: Leon Rutledge

customer_reviews.title: Died in 3 months.
customer_reviews.text: Used in Fire 10 tablet. Saved apps to it. It dies after 3 months. Just locked up. Unable to read or write from it. Computer recognizes it, can see file names. Cannot format or make any changes to disk.
customer_reviews.author: AznONEder

customer_reviews.title: Like the wind!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Only 117GB of actual storage on the card, but nonetheless...........for the price this little thing transfers files like the wind!!! Great price and PNY brand lasts a very long time!!!
customer_reviews.author: Charles Mahanna

customer_reviews.title: Great for Phone Use
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to use in my android smart phone for primary storage. After trying a few other High Speed cards this one was the best and I have had no lag when accessing apps or rebooting the phone. Very happy with this card after multiple other vendors failed to meet the mark.
customer_reviews.author: Sam24and48

customer_reviews.title: Not for Galaxy S5 - maybe for a camera
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my Samsung Galaxy S5 cell phone. It worked for about a month, and then it crashed, taking all of my photos with it. Well, at least when I try to look at it via my cell phone. Luckily, I was able to recover the photos from my computer. I'm going to try to use it for my camera, and hopefully it holds up better.
customer_reviews.author: CScott

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Great buy but unfortunately was broken when it arrived so I had to buy one locally. Great memory card though
customer_reviews.author: Jason Valentin

customer_reviews.title: I would not recommend...
customer_reviews.text: Will not work on any device I put it in. Micro card fell out of package. Seam on pack was split open. Wonder if someone pulled the old switch-a-rue on this micro sd. A lot of people are having problems with this sd card. There is no contact the vendor button either. What's up with this?
customer_reviews.author: Stephen R. Samborski

customer_reviews.title: How sad right lol
customer_reviews.text: Does not seem as stable running games or looking at pictures compared to other micro ad cards in this price range. Over all since I bought this I have completly stopped using this in all my devices and it is collecting dust. How sad right lol.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonlover2k

customer_reviews.title: So it's useless until I find a use for the 128gb card
customer_reviews.text: This doesn't work with my Sony Xperia or Samsung s8+. So it's useless until I find a use for the 128gb card. Update: doesn't work with anything at all. Tried putting it in my different phones, tablets, n2ds... nothing. Garbage card, wish I read the reviews before buying
customer_reviews.author: Eric Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Price and quality
customer_reviews.text: What else is there to say...this thing was perfect, and at half the price as others exactly the same.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: Everything you need.
customer_reviews.text: Use it for my Gopro. Advertised size is correct, transfers are fine. Beware the cheapest ones here on amazon, they are literally scams (small capacity cards spoofed to think they're 128-256gb, that simply lose all data past their actual capacity) just spend a few more bucks and get the PNY.
customer_reviews.author: Colin S. MartinTop Contributor: Calligraphy

customer_reviews.title: Went into "Read-only" mode after 3.5 months, no longer useable
customer_reviews.text: It worked as described for about 3.5 months (which was great!), but then it went into read-only mode and it is now completely write protected for no apparent reason. I could not reformat it or erase it either. I originally thought it was a problem with my Mac and was on customer service with Apple for hours, only to find in these reviews that I am not alone...it happens quite frequently with this product. I am very disappointed and displeased. I'm lucky that I had everything already backed up...be careful if you choose to use this product.
customer_reviews.author: CE

customer_reviews.title: I have used this in an enviroment of loading complete apk's (android) including obb, data, never have had an app load slow!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is, hands down, the best 128GB sd card I have purchased including prior PNY 128GB cards! All of mine (over 6) have been 128GB, including Sandisk (which I have distanced myself from), among others!
customer_reviews.author: coolbeans2016

customer_reviews.title: Not high quality memory card.
customer_reviews.text: Put this in my tablet to record dish network shows for a vacation trip. Copied shows over fine, but when I turned tablet on the first time to watch my shows, the SD card showed as corrupted and had to be reformatted. Lost all recorded TV shows. Be leery of this card if you want to keep recorded pictures on it
customer_reviews.author: Ted L

customer_reviews.title: Dead after a few Months
customer_reviews.text: I'm sad to repor, this has died after only a few months. Stick to a more reputable brand instead of trying to save a few bucks. Now I've lost many files I had stored on this in a Moto Z Force.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Strobeck

customer_reviews.title: great for nintendo switch
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my Nintendo Switch and it works great for storing save files and games.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip Mossburg

customer_reviews.title: Nice card for the money, no problems so far
customer_reviews.text: Solid card at a great price. I use it with a DJI Phantom recording at 4K and it doesn't miss a beat and video stays smooth so this card must have a door write rate. Playing video from the card is smooth as well so the read rate is good too. I will be buying another (or two) for my drone.
customer_reviews.author: David J Carter Jr

customer_reviews.title: GOOD STUFF, MAYNARD!!!
customer_reviews.text: My main system is WinXP and it reads as "not formatted". No problems, plugged it into a Win7 system on the network, shared it and just edit it's contents from there. Works GREAT in my BLU Studio 7.0 II & BLU Advance 4.0 L2 phones. Surprisingly fast for such an inexpensive device, but I've always come to expect more for my money from PNY than many other manufacturers. Good stuff!
customer_reviews.author: Carole A.

customer_reviews.title: Works for me.
customer_reviews.text: I don't know what to comment as far as the technical aspect of this but to date it has performed for what I need it to do which is store songs and pictures on my phone and has done both without a problem.
customer_reviews.author: R. Mack

customer_reviews.title: Do not purchase for Macbook Pro extra storage
customer_reviews.text: I thought I could use this for seamless extra storage on my mid 2012 Macbook Pro. No such luck. It worked well for about a month. Then the files placed on their cannot be deleted. The card cannot be reformatted in Disc Utility, nor can it be repaired. It cannot be reformatted in a Samsung camera I have. Fortunately for the manufacturer and Amazon, the window for return is over. $40 gone. Another lesson in buying cheap and getting burned. Here is a forum discussing the same problem: [...] TL;DR: Off to buy a SanDisc Ultra
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Ellen Landes

customer_reviews.title: Grest product!
customer_reviews.text: This is so easy to use. Just leave a micro SD card in it, and you've got a tiny portable hard drive. Plug in, copy, and transfer files easily, much more reliable than blue tooth and more convenient than using a cable. Speed is pretty good too. My dad usedid it and decided not to return to me! I'll definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Pair

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 6 months
customer_reviews.text: I never tested the read or write speed, I just bought this to use on my Nintendo Switch. Worked fine for around 6 months and mysteriously stopped working. Isn't recognized by my computer. Stay away from this product.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Schneider

customer_reviews.title: Not happy at this time
customer_reviews.text: I am using this on a Galaxy S4. My phone had no heating issues. Now, the phone will inconsistently heat up. It is not a continuous matter, but this never happened before the microdisc was changed. Prior microchip was a 64mg that had no issues, was just increasing memory space. Not happy at this time. Below is the seller... PNY Elite 128GB MicroSDXC Card with Adapter -UHS-I, U1, up to 85MB/Sec (P-SDU128U185EL-GE) Sold by: Amazon.com LLC $34.99
customer_reviews.author: Sun Spotman

customer_reviews.title: Too good to be true
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately the card got damaged after almost two weeks of use, it was being used in my Moto X Style, using it as additional memory for the phone, the setup was kinda tricky maybe because it is a large capacity card, but somehow just as of last night the phone notified that the card was damaged or corrupted so it's no longer usable, tried formatting it on the phone and on my laptop but impossible to do it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Functions as intended and cheap too!
customer_reviews.text: Not the fastest drive on the planet, but really a great product that I use all the time. Functions as intended and definitely the cheapest that I could find!
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Good for Nintendo 3DS
customer_reviews.text: Got the 128GB card + USB adapter for my New 3DS console. It came formatted with exFAT, I had to reformat it to FAT32 to make it work with the console but now it's been fine. The USB adapter is super handy, especially now that more laptops are removing SD card readers
customer_reviews.author: S.

customer_reviews.title: Great 128GB card from PNY!
customer_reviews.text: Great, fast microsd card. For general usage, such as in tablets or phones, this would fill the need of ~90% of the people looking for a high capacity microsd card. 128GB is a lot for a tablet or a phone, and you won't run out of space on this card anytime soon. Cheaper than the competitors, but performs relatively the same.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great price, great product.
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my cellphone and it has worked great. No problems with it. I did some research before buying but this is the cheapest deal I found. I am pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Mahlia Presley

customer_reviews.title: Yes sir!
customer_reviews.text: This card works great. What else can I really say about it? Oh it's also small...you probably knew that since these cards are all the same size. It's also green and grey so that's neat. So if you are in the market for a micro sd card that's 128gb this is the card for you.
customer_reviews.author: J. Rhodes

customer_reviews.title: Stop working after one year
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy!! it's a waste of money!! Get a Samsung or Sandisk
customer_reviews.author: amazon

customer_reviews.title: Look elsewhere
customer_reviews.text: Phone (Samsung Galaxy S5) will randomly lose access to the card and won't reconnect until it is physically removed, rebooted, turned off again, and reinserted. This does not happen with other cards and is extremely inconvenient while out and about.
customer_reviews.author: Rake

product_meta.title: PNY Elite 128GB, up to 85MB/Sec, Microsdxc Card -UHS-I, U1 (P-SDU128U185EL-GE)
product_meta.description: Size:128GBThe PNY Elite performance 128GB Class 10, UHS-I, U1 micro SD, Flash card is perfect for the latest smartphones, tablets, action cameras, and drones. It features 128GB of storage, giving you more storage space on your mobile device so you can easily enjoy more mobile content such as apps, eBooks, web video, music and movies. U1 technology is perfect for full HD video recording and HD photography, allowing you to capture high quality HD video and photos with your action camera, drone, or other mobile device. The Elite micro SD card is rated Class 10, U1, which guarantees fast transfer speeds so you can quickly transfer and share your content while you're on the go.
feature_bullets: Class 10 UHS I, U1 speed class performance allows for fast and smooth continuous shooting and full HD video recording
Perfect for android smartphones & tablets, action cameras, drones, computers, and more
Record and transfer videos, photos, music, files and more at amazing fast speeds
Great for full HD video content, HD photography and more.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars1,322 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
